results.title: The Big roar
results.creator_credit: Daniel Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Daniel Young didn’t feel safe the night before the tornado roared through his house. After it had passed, Young’s family were safe but it had left a great wave of destruction in its path.

On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: The Big river: a River Murray story
results.brief_description: Recreates life as it was in the Murray River district during the 19th century. Traces the development of the area from Swan Hill to Echuca, which became the centre of one of the largest navigable river systems in the world. Considers the re-shaping of the river by man for irrigation, development of farming in the area, and growth of Echuca as a port.

results.title: The Big red one
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Gene Corman, United Artists Corporation and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: The combat Sergeant’s duty is to make sure that the men under his charge stay alive. Some of them are barely out of high school and must face the mental and physical challenges of war. The First Infantry Division’s insignia is named the “Big Red One’. The men in this division battle their way through North Africa, Sicily, Omaha Beach and Belgium until they confront the horrors of the Nazi Death Camps. Lee Marvin is the Sergeant, joined by Mark Hamill and Robert Carradine in this excellent portrayal of the realities and horror of war.

results.title: The Big red barn
results.creator_credit: Robert Ennis, John Churchill, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the daily life and activities of the domesticated animals of a farm that live together in the big red barn. Encourages creativity in oral and written expression, as the film is narrated in rhyming verse. Based on the story by Margaret Wise Brown. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: The Big picture: conservation treatment of a large painting
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Department of Home Affairs and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Conservators, Allan Byrne and Tom Dixon, discuss the restoration of the huge oil paint by Tom Roberts entitled “The Opening of the First Parliament of the Australian Commonwealth by His Majesty King George V (when Duke of York). 9th May 1901”. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: The Big one
results.creator_credit: Michael Moore, Kathleen Glynn, Dog Eat Dog Films, BBC, Mayfair Entertainment International and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Michael Moore, this is a documentary account of Moore travelling across America to promote his most recent book “Downsize this: random threats from an unarmed American”. Moore, unbeknown to the book’s publishers, gathers a film crew to follow him as he gives public lectures, signs books and gives surprise visits to large corporations. Moore challenges some executives at large companies asking why they are ‘downsizing’ staff in a time of record profits. He visits not only large cities but also some small towns - including one town that was listed as the worst in America. He talks to workers and townsfolk who are trying to live on minimum wage and those who have not had pay increases in many, many years. Large factories are closing down across America as companies use cheaper overseas labour in their manufacturing processes. Only one CEO agrees to an interview, the head of Nike, and he does not provide Michael with a happy ending to his film - Nike shoes are not manufactured in America and are made by teenage workers in Indonesia (minimum age of 14) - something the CEO has no problem with. Using his unique mix of humour, compassion and outright brashness, Moore has created a glimpse into the social and political climate in America in the late 1990s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Moore, Kathleen Glynn, Dog Eat Dog Films, BBC, Mayfair Entertainment International and Miramax Films

results.title: The Big muster
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Ben Burgandy and A M P Society
results.brief_description: Shows the rural holdings of the Australian Mutual Provident Society, and its contribution to the cattle industry in Australia. This is a record of the contribution the A.M.P. Society and its policyholders are making to the Australian beef industry. Shows pasture improvement on established properties, development of new pastures and marketing.

results.title: The Big mill
results.creator_credit: Laurence Henson, Jack Holmes and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: The Big Mill is a steel strip mill at Motherwell, outside Glasgow. The film follows the processes of making, testing and rolling hot steel slabs and sheeting, destined for use in every branch of modern life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Henson, Jack Holmes and Templar Film Studios

results.title: The Big lift
results.creator_credit: George Seaton and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Montgomery Clift and Paul Douglas star in this reenactment of the Berlin airlift of 1948 which occurred as a result of a Russian blockade of the western sector; refusing to allow the Allies to ship food supplies to starving Berliners. An airlift proves to be the only solution. Paul Douglas stars as ground operations sergeant Frank Kowalski, and Montgomery Clift as pilot Danny MacCullough, both of whom have differing views on the matter. Cornell Borchers features as a love interest.

results.title: The Big Lebowski
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: The plot of this Raymond Chandleresque comedy-drama crime caper from the Coen Brothers pivots around a case of mistaken identity. Unemployed and laid-back, 70s refugee Jeff “The Dude” Lebowski likes hanging out with his friends and bowling. His life takes an alternate route when two thugs break into his home and soil his rug in the belief that they are accosting Jeff Lebowski, the Pasadena millionaire. The Dude looks up his wealthy namesake and manages to get a replacement for his soiled rug, but he also manages to embroil himself in a story of extortion, double-cross, deception, embezzlement, sex and dope. Cast includes Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi, Ben Gazzara and John Turturro.
